intro: Pimpinella thellungiana var. gustavohegiana, commonly known as the Gustavo Hegi's cowparsley, is a variant of the cowparsley species native to southern Europe. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and woodland edges. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. Its botanical features make it distinguishable from other Pimpinella species through its specific morphological traits.
